Europeans spend 575 million hours a year clicking cookie banners. So EU released the digital omnibus. the biggest update to the rules since GDPR in 2018. Here's what's changing. First, if a company has your data but can't figure out who you are from it, they don't have to protect it like personal data anymore. Second, companies can use your data to train AI without [music] asking you first. They just need a legitimate reason. You can say no, but most people won't even know it's happening. Third, companies can ignore your data access requests if they think you're misusing them, and they can use more cookies without asking. Business groups love it. They say it'll save5 billion by 2029.
